rules.natural: Under the condition that a person has a tool, it is not the case that the person breaks the tool.
If a person is an expert in a technology, then whenever that person replaces a tool, the person has the tool.
Either a person is an expert in a technology or a person is a novice in a technology.
Supposing a person is a novice in a technology, then if that person replaces a tool, the person has the tool.
In the event that a person is a mentor to another person, that person teaches the other person.
A person is a mentor to another person or a person is a student of another person.
Should a person be a student of another person, that person learns from the other person.
Assuming a person learns from another person, then whenever that person replaces a tool, the person has the tool.
If a person is a manager of an event, then if it is not the case that replacing a tool implies not breaking the tool, then the person does not succeed at the event.
Provided that a person is a coordinator of an event, then if it is not the case that replacing a tool implies not breaking the tool, then the person does not succeed at the event.
In the case that a person is a director of an event, then either that person is a manager of the event or a coordinator of the event.
A person is a director of an event or a person is a supervisor of an event.
Whenever a person is a supervisor of an event, that person leads the event.
If a person leads an event, then that person is either a manager of the event or a coordinator of the event.
Supposing a person designs furniture, then that person creates furniture.
Given that a person manufactures furniture, then that person designs furniture.
If a person attends an event, then if it is not the case that using a technology implies manufacturing furniture, then the person fails at the event.
In the event that a person repairs a tool, it is not the case that the person breaks the tool.
A person repairs a tool or a person replaces a tool.
In the case that it is not the case that replacing a tool implies not breaking the tool, then a person succeeds at the event.
Under the condition that an event is not a workshop, a person uses a technology.
Provided that an event is not a workshop, a person breaks a tool.

Assuming it is not the case that replacing a tool implies not breaking the tool, then a person does not succeed at the event.

(A1 → A2).natural: If a person uses a technology, then that person creates furniture.

(A1 → A3).natural: Provided that a person uses a technology, that person designs furniture.

(A1 → A4).natural: Whenever a person uses a technology, that person manufactures furniture.

(A10 → ¬A7).natural: Under the condition that a person has a tool, it is not the case that the person breaks the tool.

(A11 → (A9 → A10)).natural: If a person is an expert in a technology, then whenever that person replaces a tool, the person has the tool.

(A11 ∨ A12).natural: Either a person is an expert in a technology or a person is a novice in a technology.

(A12 → (A9 → A10)).natural: Supposing a person is a novice in a technology, then if that person replaces a tool, the person has the tool.

(A13 ∨ (A9 → A10)).natural: A person teaches another person or, if a person replaces a tool, then the person has the tool.

(A14 → A13).natural: In the event that a person is a mentor to another person, that person teaches the other person.

(A14 ∨ A15).natural: A person is a mentor to another person or a person is a student of another person.

(A15 → (A9 → A10)).natural: Given that a person is a student of another person, then if that person replaces a tool, the person has the tool.

(A15 → A16).natural: Should a person be a student of another person, that person learns from the other person.

(A16 → (A9 → A10)).natural: Assuming a person learns from another person, then whenever that person replaces a tool, the person has the tool.

(A18 → (¬(A9 → ¬A7) → ¬A17)).natural: If a person is a manager of an event, then if it is not the case that replacing a tool implies not breaking the tool, then the person does not succeed at the event.

(A18 ∨ A19).natural: A person is a manager of an event or a person is a coordinator of an event.

(A19 → (¬(A9 → ¬A7) → ¬A17)).natural: Provided that a person is a coordinator of an event, then if it is not the case that replacing a tool implies not breaking the tool, then the person does not succeed at the event.

(A20 → (A18 ∨ A19)).natural: In the case that a person is a director of an event, then either that person is a manager of the event or a coordinator of the event.

(A20 ∨ A21).natural: A person is a director of an event or a person is a supervisor of an event.

(A21 → (A18 ∨ A19)).natural: Under the condition that a person is a supervisor of an event, then that person is either a manager of the event or a coordinator of the event.

(A21 → A22).natural: Whenever a person is a supervisor of an event, that person leads the event.

(A22 → (A18 ∨ A19)).natural: If a person leads an event, then that person is either a manager of the event or a coordinator of the event.

(A3 → A2).natural: Supposing a person designs furniture, then that person creates furniture.

(A4 → A3).natural: Given that a person manufactures furniture, then that person designs furniture.

(A6 → (¬(A1 → A4) → A5)).natural: If a person attends an event, then if it is not the case that using a technology implies manufacturing furniture, then the person fails at the event.

(A8 → ¬A7).natural: In the event that a person repairs a tool, it is not the case that the person breaks the tool.

(A8 ∨ A9).natural: A person repairs a tool or a person replaces a tool.

(A9 → A10).natural: Provided that a person replaces a tool, that person has the tool.

(A9 → ¬A7).natural: Should a person replace a tool, it is not the case that the person breaks the tool.

(¬(A1 → A4) → A5).natural: If it is not the case that using a technology implies manufacturing furniture, then a person fails at the event.

(¬(A9 → ¬A7) → A17).natural: In the case that it is not the case that replacing a tool implies not breaking the tool, then a person succeeds at the event.

(¬(A9 → ¬A7) → ¬A17).natural: Assuming it is not the case that replacing a tool implies not breaking the tool, then a person does not succeed at the event.

(¬G → A1).natural: Under the condition that an event is not a workshop, a person uses a technology.

(¬G → A7).natural: Provided that an event is not a workshop, a person breaks a tool.
